name: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4301
Reason: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione has a melting point of 120°C. The basic unit for this compound is pyran, which has a melting point of 100°C. The methyl groups increase the melting point by approximately +20°C due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
